title: James Young (footballer, born 1882)
text:
James Young (10 January 1882 – 4 September 1922) was a Scottish <a href="association%20football">football</a> player, best known for playing as a <a href="wing%20half">right half</a> for the highly successful <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> side of the early 1900s. Young helped Celtic to win fifteen major trophies in total, comprising nine <a href="list%20of%20Scottish%20football%20champions">league championships</a> and six <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a>s. His career was ended by a knee injury suffered in 1916.
Young made one appearance for the <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland national football team</a>, against <a href="Ireland%20national%20football%20team%20%281882%E2%80%931950%29">Ireland</a> in 1906. He also represented the <a href="Scottish%20League%20XI">Scottish League XI</a> six times.
He died in a <a href="motorcycle">motorcycle</a> accident in his native Ayrshire, aged 40.
In October 2013, a biography "Sunny Jim Young - Celtic Legend" written by <a href="David%20W.%20Potter">David W. Potter</a> was published.
